website_summaries.verdict: Formulated to keep squirrels at bay, since they can taste the hot pepper, whereas the birds can’t.
pros: The high energy suet base leaves no waste or mess and is ready to feed
Designed for suet, fruit and insect eating birds, it can be used in a variety of feeders
cons: Some found their backyard birds took a while to adjust to it

customer_reviews.title: Our birds love them
customer_reviews.text: I have read some reviews stating that their birds did not like the nuggets. I live in the Northeast and my property has numerous nut trees that invite many squirrels in. Since I have been using the hot nuggets, last 4 winters, I have not seen a squirrel at the feeders. As far as birds, we get a wide variety, including woodpeckers. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Elspeth

customer_reviews.title: Dissolves in the rain
customer_reviews.text: The birds like these and squirrels don't; but when it rains the pellets disolve and turn into a single mush pile... Some birds don't care, but birds that like to pick up a piece and carry it away don't
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels will eat it too
customer_reviews.text: I bought the hot pepper version to deter the squirrels, but it doesn’t. There is plenty of cayenne pepper on the nuggets as my eyes were watering as I filled the feeder. The birds love this stuff. It is a bit expensive though as the birds quickly eat it up. Don’t get the hot pepper as it will not deter the squirrels, so it isn’t worth what it could do to your eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Joann B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the few things we've found that discourages deer and squirrels from emptying the bird feeders.The idea was appealing--maybe the deer wouldn't pull down and break the feeders. At least that's what I hoped. Well, the deer didn't try to eat the nuggets. HOWEVER, the birds didn't eat it either. We filled several feeders before a recent cold spell (10 degrees and colder) and the food was untouched for three weeks. I've cancelled my subscription order because none of my yard pals will touch this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our warblers love this!
customer_reviews.text: We've always used hot pepper suet cakes but never tried the pellets before so I took a chance and ordered some. It didn't take but a couple of days before the warblers migrating thru our area discovered the feeder with the hot pepper pellets inside, and the feeder is covered by them when they come to the feeder. Have only had the pellets out for a week, and so far we haven't seen other kinds of birds at the feeder yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sue D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for repelling squirrels!
customer_reviews.text: We were plagued with squirrels knocking down our suet feeder and nearly destroying it. They absolutely hate the hot pepper suet and are leaving the feeder alone. We do mix in stuff we get cheaper elsewhere, and find that a mix of 2/3 hot pepper to other (bird seed, plain suet balls) seems to work the best. Now, if we could only keep the resident falcon away from the birds.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Odonnell

customer_reviews.title: A great alternative to suet feeders
customer_reviews.text: Addictive! Great alternative to suet feeders. With “hot pepper” option, I can set this out and feed a large variety of birds, not have to clean elaborate feeders and there is little shedding.
customer_reviews.author: Sydonie

customer_reviews.title: the birds love it
customer_reviews.text: As there are a number of animals in my area who would eat suet if it wasn't flavored with hot pepper, this worked. It was easy to scatter and place in feeders for the birds. This was often the first item that the birds would go after. The flavor - don't know as I didn't taste it, but the birds love it.
customer_reviews.author: pema drolma

customer_reviews.title: The squirrels stay away from them - BUT SO DO THE BIRDS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well I thought these a great idea and would work like the pepper suet cakes. But not a single bird that came into my yard in the last couple of weeks will even touch them! I even saw a crow take a few and toss them to the ground!
customer_reviews.author: Ferretocious

customer_reviews.title: They go fast
customer_reviews.text: Our birds really chow down on these pellets and when the month is over I know I’ll be looking for my new supply from Amazon. And also a major consideration - the squirrels won’t touch it. As you can see, the feeder needs refilling again,
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen A

customer_reviews.title: Repels squirrels
customer_reviews.text: These are great mixed with regular birdseed to discourage squirrels.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it
customer_reviews.text: The hot pepper keeps the squirrels away so you are not feeding squirrels, just the birds.
customer_reviews.author: MiMi

customer_reviews.title: My birds don’t like it. Going back to seeds.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one bag to see if the birds would like it. It didn’t go as fast as a hot seed mix I was using prior but it took about double the time to finish the feeder. I thought because they were feeding slower I wouldn’t have to fill the feeder as often so I purchased 6 bags. Since the first fill of the new batch the birds haven’t touched the feeder in over a week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get the full order.
customer_reviews.text: Only received 5 of the 6 bags ordered. Too expense to order this again and not get the whole order.
customer_reviews.author: KG Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Too hot for out squirrels
customer_reviews.text: The birds love this, the squirrels do not. This is easy to dispense and the squirrels look elsewhere, so I will buy it again,
customer_reviews.author: Nancy G

customer_reviews.title: Too Popular?
customer_reviews.text: The birds definitely love it but I'm not sure I can afford to keep feeding it as an entire bag sometimes disappears in a day. I have not seen any squirrels on the feeder but I am suspicious!
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Barton

customer_reviews.title: Works great in our tube feeder for woodpeckers
customer_reviews.text: Woodpeckers and nuthatches fight over whose turn it is on the tube feeder with these in it. For the first time since we moved here we have winter visiting Sapsuckers who are the first ones dining on this every morning. Thrilled with the quality and birds agree!
customer_reviews.author: MKchs

customer_reviews.title: Too hot for squirrels to handle
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels eat anything I put out there, but they take 1 bite of this and they run. The birds love it though.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Birds are offended if it's not out.
customer_reviews.text: Birds love it. Squirrels won't touch this flavor. Bit pricey so my savages will get it as a treat. Easy, no mess.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect treat for the birds
customer_reviews.text: My birds LOVE this. And it provides the extra fat they need in the winter months. And the squirrels hate it!
customer_reviews.author: ksn

customer_reviews.title: Lots of birds & no squirrels to feed
customer_reviews.text: All types of birds love it & squirrels avoid it. We go through a bag every week in the “busy season”.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Wrong item shipped
customer_reviews.text: I always order the hot pepper because squirrels will leave it alone... received the peanut butter... birds like it too, so I kept it! Otherwise, a good product
customer_reviews.author: indianscoach

customer_reviews.title: Birdies Like it
customer_reviews.text: Nice price for the six pack. Birds love it, and now thanks to Amazon I don't have to spend 30 minutes in a car each way to get it and then pay almost $8 per bag. Blue Jays and Woodpeckers favor these nuggets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: squirrel proof!
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of problems with squirrels trashing my suet feeders. They don't like this stuff but woodpeckers absolutely adore it. No more squirrel problem! Shipped quickly and was well packaged, but only four stars because I think the price is a bit on the high end for suet.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel deterrent!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the squirrels from eating all the birds food! I am grateful!
customer_reviews.author: M. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: ... tried the Hot Pepper Nuggets and not seemed to like them. However
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels have tried the Hot Pepper Nuggets and not seemed to like them. However, the birds haven't been attracted by them so far.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the squirrels away
customer_reviews.text: By purchasing these Hot Pepper Nuggets I'm finally able to keep the squirrels from devouring my suet. They no longer bother my feeders and the nuggets are lasting a lot longer than before, so I'm saving money!
customer_reviews.author: Caiti

customer_reviews.title: Dried out
customer_reviews.text: I have been ordering this for a while but with this order all the bags, the balls seemed very dried out and birds that generally love them not too interested
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Klein

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My birds especially the red bellied woodpeckers love this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: M. Neikirk

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: This product is ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL! I deal with a LOT of squirrels, but they DO NOT like to eat these! The birds love it though, especially the woodpeckers. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: what more could I ask?
customer_reviews.text: the birds love it, and the squirrels don't touch it!
customer_reviews.author: nan k

customer_reviews.title: these are great and the birds LOVE them
customer_reviews.text: these are great and the birds LOVE them. and you don't get squirrels or other undesirables like mice or rats.
customer_reviews.author: Afkanv;lkjaefpo

customer_reviews.title: Can't keep enough of this in the bird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. I decided to purchase this in bulk because the birds absolutely love these nuggets, so I have to refill my feeder every few days. What I love most about these hot pepper nuggets, is that the squirrels have no interest in them. I've seen about 5 different types of birds at the feeder - love it!
customer_reviews.author: Selective Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Ignored by the birds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in the spring as a change of pace in addition to the sunflower seeds I usually use. I was hoping to attract some of the other species of birds in the neighborhood ( I live in north central CT). The good news is that the squirrels and chipmunks were not interested in the nuggets. The bad news is neither were the birds. I tried them in a feeder, on a "plate" and I even threw them on the ground. I couldn't seem to attract any of the birds that were supposed to like the product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C.

customer_reviews.title: Our yard birds favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This product is spectacular. All our wild birds absolutely adore it. I have to reorder frequently to keep them happy!
customer_reviews.author: m4nman

customer_reviews.title: Well, they are squirrel proof, but seem to be bird proof too
customer_reviews.text: I had a terrible time with the squirrels getting into my bird feeders, so I thought I would fight fire with fire. And it worked! NO SQUIRRELS at the feeder. Problem is; no birds, either. And I have a case of this stuff. But guess what, the food magically disappears, but only at night. So guess what that means? It means rats LOVE spicy foods. May as well call it rat food. Maybe the rats will just die of obesity.
customer_reviews.author: APC

customer_reviews.title: Blue Jay approaved
customer_reviews.text: My birdies have no problem with this, how ever, the peanut suet nuggets are a tad too big for small birds like chickadees, thou I did see one grab a nugget. My blue jays like em. I probably should have got 1 instead of the 6 pack. Itll probably last 3 or 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E.

customer_reviews.title: The squirrels so far dislike this brand better than the other
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels are staying away so far. A few birds have showed up. Will update after a week or two.🤞🏻🤞🏻🤞🏻🤞🏻🤞🏻
customer_reviews.author: Gail D

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel s don’t like them 👏🏻
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use , wish there was a bigger bag
customer_reviews.author: cathleen Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Aviary Yard!!
customer_reviews.text: We looked for a feeder that would deter the rather ravenous squirrels. This feeder was the answer. At first they actually gnawed the metal webbing on the cylinder but, of course, got no where. Birds of many type flock to this edible delight and are fascinating to watch. We are finding ourselves filling the dispenser every other day it has become so popular. Thank you C and J
customer_reviews.author: Krafty

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it - no squirrels or rats for me
customer_reviews.text: squirrels were eating and breaking my feeders so I switched to hot pepper suet & these nuggets - no issues! In fact, every morning the birds bring me a 'present' 1+ not yet ripe blackberries.
customer_reviews.author: Lily’s personal assistant

customer_reviews.title: Our birds love these nuggets
customer_reviews.text: Birds are wild about the nuggets. Can't keep feeders full fast enough.
customer_reviews.author: W. H. Taylor Jr.

product_meta.title: C & S Products Hot Pepper Nuggets, 6-Piece
product_meta.description: Hot Pepper Suet Nuggets can be fed alone on a platform feeder or Nugget/Peanut/Sunflower feeder using 1/3" wire mesh. This formulation has a high-energy fat base and is processed even further to produce a soft nugget that is appealing to suet, insect and fruit eating songbirds . Ideal when mixed with 5-10 lbs. of seed in a traditional feeder. Resealable bag.
feature_bullets: Helps reduce visits of squirrels at your feeder
Treats will become soft and pliable at 100 degrees if exposed to extreme heat
Attract more birds & fewer squirrels with hot peppers
It's suitable for year round use and comes in a resealable package ready for easy dispensing into your feeder
Easy to serve, no-mess & no-waste nuggets
Age range description: All Life Stages
